metadata.title: CVE-2016-7632 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 10.2 isaffected. Safari before 10.0.2 is affected. iCloud before 6.1 is affected.iTunes before 12.5.4 is affected. The issue involves the "WebKit"component. It allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause adenial of service (memory corruption and application crash) via a craftedweb site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7632` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.14.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.14.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.14.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.14.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.14.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.14.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
webkit2gtk package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.14.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
